title: Reason gas pressure is lower than ideal gas law

content.prompt: A 1.0 L sample of a pure gas is found to have a lower pressure than that predicted by the ideal gas law. The best explanation for the observation is that the molecules of the gas

choices.label: have a combined volume that is too large to be considered negligible when compared to the volume of the container
have a low molecular mass and therefore do not strike the container walls with as much force as expected
are attracted to each other and do not exert as much force on the container walls as they would if they had no mutual attractions
are attracted to the sides of the container and strike the container walls with more force than expected

skill.text: 4.D: Explain the degree to which a model or representation describes the connection between particulate-level properties and macroscopic properties.
